</B>
	&#148;) (as hereinafter defined) who use the Fitness Center to execute waiver documents in the form
	attached to this Sublease as
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;C
</U>
	. and Subtenant shall indemnify and hold harmless Sublandlord, Prime Landlord, and VistaPrint Limited from and against any and all claims, demands, suits, judgments, liabilities, costs and expenses,
	including reasonable attorneys&#146; fees, arising out of or in connection with the use of the Fitness Center by Subtenant or any of Subtenant&#146;s agents, invitees, employees, or contractors (collectively, &#147;
<B>
	Subtenant&#146;s Fitness Center
	Users
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	16.
<U>
	Security Deposit
</U>
	. On or prior to the date hereof, Subtenant shall provide Sublandlord with a letter of
	credit in the form attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;D
</U>
	from a financial institution reasonably satisfactory to Sublandlord (and Sublandlord acknowledges that Bank of America is satisfactory) in the original amount of $450,000. Subtenant shall
	maintain such letter of credit until the date that is sixty (60)&nbsp;days after expiration of the Sublease Term. Subtenant may reduce the security deposit to $345,000 on the third anniversary of the Sublease Term Commencement Date and to $225,000
	on the fifth anniversary of the Sublease Term Commencement Date;
<I>
	provided
</I>
	that at the time of each such reduction no defaults have occurred under this Sublease beyond applicable notice and grace periods. Sublandlord shall confirm in writing
	that the conditions for reduction of the Letter of Credit have been satisfied as of the applicable review date (which confirmation Sublandlord agrees to provide within ten (10)&nbsp;Business Days after Subtenant&#146;s written request, if correct),
	and, Subtenant may provide Sublandlord with an amendment to the Letter of Credit or a new Letter of Credit meeting all of the requirements of this Section&nbsp;16 to accomplish such authorized reduction of the Letter of Credit. Such letter of credit
	may be drawn from time to time by Sublandlord upon Subtenant&#146;s default of its obligations under this Sublease, beyond any applicable notice and cure periods, or if such letter of credit is about to expire and has not been renewed within thirty
	(30)&nbsp;days preceding such expiration. Should Sublandlord draw down the letter of credit, Subtenant shall be obligated to restore it to the then required amount under this Section&nbsp;16. Sublandlord shall assign the security deposit to a
	successor or transferee and, following the assignment, Sublandlord shall have no further liability with respect to the security deposit. If the letter of credit is drawn down and held by Sublandlord as a cash security deposit, Sublandlord
	(i)&nbsp;shall not be required to keep the security deposit separate from its other accounts, and (ii)&nbsp;shall return any unapplied portion of the security deposit to Subtenant within sixty (60)&nbsp;days after the later to occur of the
	expiration of the Sublease Term or the date Subtenant surrenders the Premises to Sublandlord in compliance with this Sublease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	17.
<U>
	Contingency
</U>
	. This Sublease is conditioned upon the completion of the following (the &#147;
<B>
	Contingencies
</B>
	&#148;) on or before November&nbsp;13, 2015 (the &#147;
<B>
	Contingency Date
</B>
	&#148;): (a)&nbsp;the consent of Prime Landlord to
	this Sublease substantially in the form attached hereto as
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;E
</U>
	(the &#147;
<B>
	Consent
</B>
	&#148;); and (b)&nbsp;the final approval by Prime Landlord and Sublandlord of the Plans to be provided by Subtenant under the Work Letter,
	including agreement as to (i)&nbsp;installation rooftop condenser units, access thereto and removal thereof, and (ii)&nbsp;whether portions of Sublandlord&#146;s work will be required by Prime Landlord to be removed or restored at the end of the
	Prime Lease Term. If the Contingencies are not satisfied by the Contingency Date, either
<B>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	8
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage179"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	party may elect to terminate this Sublease by notice to the other party within ten (10)&nbsp;Business Days following such Contingency Date. If this Sublease is so terminated: (i)&nbsp;all amounts
	previously paid by either party to the other on account of this Sublease shall be returned; and (ii)&nbsp;the parties thereupon shall be relieved of any further liability or obligation under this Sublease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18.
<U>
	Signage
</U>
	. Sublandlord agrees to provide to Subtenant, and install at Sublandlord&#146;s sole cost and expense, signs identifying
	Tenant and, if requested, Tenant&#146;s logo in the following locations:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A. On park signage approaching the Building;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B. On the large wall facing the plaza at the main entrance on the east side of the Building, to be shared with Sublandlord and other
	subtenants;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C. In the main lobby of the Building at the reception desk; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D. At the entrance to the Subleased Premises,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All signs shall be installed in accordance with plans and specifications prepared by Subtenant and approved by Sublandlord, which approval shall not be
	unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	19.
<U>
	Expansion Right
</U>
	. Subject to the provisions of this Section&nbsp;19 , so long
	as at least three years remain in the Sublease Term, including the Extension Right, if exercised by Subtenant, Subtenant shall have an ongoing right of first offer (the &#147;
<B>
	Right of First Offer
</B>
	&#148;) on any then-available portions of the
	second floor of the Building (each, a &#147;
<B>
	ROFO Space
</B>
	&#148;) upon the following terms and conditions. This Right of First Offer is subject and subordinate to the right of Sublandlord or any affiliate of Sublandlord to use or occupy such ROFO
	Space, but no other party holds expansion or first offer or refusal rights to the ROFO Space that are superior to the rights of Subtenant set forth in this Section&nbsp;19.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Sublandlord will notify Subtenant of its plans to market a ROFO Space (the &#147;
<B>
	ROFO Notice
</B>
	&#148;) for lease to any party unrelated to
	Sublandlord (it being acknowledged and agreed that the Right of First Offer shall not be applicable to space Sublandlord intends to occupy and/or provide to affiliates of Sublandlord), which ROFO Notice shall specify the location and square footage
	for such ROFO Space, Sublandlord&#146;s estimate of the Fair Market Rent (as defined below) for such ROFO Space, the date of availability of such ROFO Space and all other material terms and conditions which will apply to such ROFO Space. Within ten
	(10)&nbsp;business days following its receipt of any ROFO Notice, Subtenant shall have the right to accept the same by written notice to Sublandlord (the &#147;
<B>
	ROFO Acceptance Notice
</B>
	&#148;);
<I>
	provided
</I>
	that if Subtenant disputes
	Sublandlord&#146;s estimate of the Fair Market Rent in the ROFO Acceptance Notice, the Fair Market Rent for such space shall be determined as set forth in Section&nbsp;20 (as appropriately modified to determine fair market rent for expansion space
	as opposed to a renewal term). If Subtenant timely delivers a ROFO Acceptance Notice, Sublandlord and Subtenant shall execute an amendment to this Sublease, subject to Prime Landlord approval and consent, incorporating the ROFO Space into the
	Subleased Premises for the remainder of the Sublease Term, as the
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	9
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage180"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	same may be extended, upon the terms contained in the ROFO Notice within ten (10)&nbsp;business days following Sublandlord&#146;s delivery to Subtenant of a form therefor (and if the
	Sublandlord&#146;s determination of Fair Market Rent was disputed in the ROFO Notice and not agreed to as of the commencement of the term for such ROFO Space, then rent shall be Sublandlord&#146;s determination of Fair Market Rent until the
	finalization of the Fair Market Rent appraisal, and any change in such rent amount shall be adjusted - with applicable credits or reimbursement for any underpayment or overpayment - thereafter). In no event shall the Fair Market Rent for the ROFO
	Space be less than the then current Base Rent for the Subleased Premises.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If Subtenant fails to timely deliver a ROFO Acceptance Notice
	within said ten (10)&nbsp;business day period or fails to execute Sublandlord&#146;s form of amendment for such ROFO Space within ten (10)&nbsp;business days of receipt from Sublandlord of the same. Subtenant shall be deemed to have waived its
	rights with respect to a ROFO Space and Sublandlord shall be entitled, but not required, to lease all or any portion of such ROFO Space to any party or parties on such terms and conditions, including, without limitation, options to extend the term
	of such lease and/or expand the premises under such lease, and for such rent as Sublandlord determines, all in its sole discretion, and the Right of First Offer with respect to such ROFO Space in such ROFO Notice shall be of no further force or
	effect.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding any contrary provision of this Sublease, any Right of First Offer, and any exercise by Subtenant of any Right of
	First Offer shall be void and of no effect unless on the date Subtenant timely delivers a ROFO Acceptance Notice to Sublandlord and on the commencement date of the amendment for a ROFO Space (as applicable): (i)&nbsp;this Sublease is in full force
	and effect, (ii)&nbsp;no default has occurred under this Sublease which remains continuing and uncured after any applicable notice and opportunity to cure and (iii)&nbsp;Subtenant shall not have assigned this Sublease, except as may be assigned
	through a Permitted Transfer, and there shall not be any sub-sublease or sub-subleases then in effect except for Permitted Transfers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subtenant acknowledges and agrees that Subtenant&#146;s Right of First Offer with respect to any space that is not subject to a third-party
	lease on the date hereof (the &#147;
<B>
	Vacant Space
</B>
	&#148;) shall not be of any force or effect until such time as such Vacant Space has been initially leased to a third-party tenant after the date hereof and such tease (and any rights held by
	such tenant in any part of the Building consisting of a ROFO Space) has subsequently expired.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	20.
<U>
	Extension Option
</U>
	. Subject to the
	terms hereof, Subtenant shall have the right (&#147;
<B>
	Extension Right
</B>
	&#148;) to extend the Sublease Term on the same terms and conditions as this Sublease except for the change in Base Rent as provided below and there shall be no further
	Renewal Options.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Provided that (i)&nbsp;a default as described in this Sublease shall not have occurred and be continuing beyond
	applicable notice and cure periods on the day on which Subtenant purports to exercise the Extension Right on the first day of the Renewal Term (as defined below), and (ii)&nbsp;the Subtenant named herein or a Permitted Transferee is actually
	occupying at least 75% of the entire Subleased Premises as of each of said dates, Subtenant shall have the option (&#147;
<B>
	Extension Option
</B>
	&#148;) to extend the Sublease Term until August&nbsp;15, 2026 (the &#147;
<B>
	Renewal Term
</B>
	&#148;),
	unless sooner terminated as provided in this Sublease, subject to all the terms of this Sublease except for the change in Base Rent as provided below and there shall be no further Extension Option.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	10
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage181"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subtenant shall exercise the Renewal Option, if at all, by giving written notice (&#147;
<B>
	Notice
	to Renew
</B>
	&#148;) of exercise to Sublandlord no later than fifteen (15)&nbsp;months prior to expiration of the Sublease Terra. If Subtenant fails to give such notice to Sublandlord within such time, Subtenant shall be deemed to have waived the
	right to exercise the Renewal Option. Upon Subtenant&#146;s exercise of the Renewal Option, the Sublease Term shall be deemed to include the Renewal Term.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The annual Base Rent payable during the Renewal Term shall be the fair market rent for comparable first class office space in effect in the
	128 West office market on the commencement date of the Renewal Term (the &#147;
<B>
	Fair Market Rent
</B>
	&#148;). The determination of Fair Market Rent (whether such determination is made by Sublandlord and/or Subtenant or the brokers referenced
	herein) shall take into account all relevant factors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Fair Market Rent shall be determined as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(1) Within fifteen (15)&nbsp;calendar days after receipt of a Notice to Renew, Sublandlord shall furnish Subtenant with Sublandlord&#146;s
	estimate of Fair Market Rent (&#147;
<B>
	Sublandlord&#146;s Rent Estimate
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(2) Within fifteen (15)&nbsp;calendar days after
	receipt of Sublandlord&#146;s Rent Estimate, Subtenant shall respond and specify whether and the extent to which Subtenant disputes Sublandlord&#146;s Rent Estimate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(3) If Subtenant disputes Sublandlord&#146;s Rent Estimate, Subtenant and Sublandlord shall negotiate in good faith for an additional thirty
	(30)&nbsp;calendar days to reach agreement on the Fair Market Rent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(4) If Subtenant and Sublandlord shall not have reached agreement as
	to the Fair Market Rent after such additional thirty (30)&nbsp;calendar days, Sublandlord and Subtenant, within ten (10)&nbsp;calendar days after the expiration of such thirty (30)&nbsp;calendar day period, shall each select a real estate broker
	affiliated with a major Boston commercial real estate brokerage firm and having at least fifteen (15)&nbsp;years&#146; experience in the field with office properties similar to the Building in the Boston area to determine the Fair Market Rent. The
	two selected brokers shall within fourteen (14)&nbsp;calendar days appoint a third broker having the qualifications described above (the &#147;
<B>
	Third Broker
</B>
	&#148;). Each party shall pay the fees and expenses of the broker it selected and the
	fees and expenses of the Third Broker shall be borne equally by both parties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(5) Within thirty (30)&nbsp;calendar days after the
	selection of the Third Broker, the brokers shall determine the Fair Market Rent In the event that the brokers have not agreed upon the Fair Market Rent within such thirty (30)&nbsp;day period, each broker shall simultaneously deliver, within ten
	(10)&nbsp;calendar days thereafter, a written appraisal of the Fair Market Rent to Sublandlord and Subtenant, and the Fair Market Rent shall be the average of the two closest appraisals.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	11
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage182"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(6) If Sublandlord or Subtenant shall have failed to designate a broker within the time period
	provided therefor above, then the broker which has been designated, whether by Sublandlord or Subtenant, shall alone make the determination of the Fair Market Rent. If Subtenant and Sublandlord have both designated brokers but the two brokers so
	designated do not agree upon and designate the third broker willing so to act within the time period provided therefor above, the Subtenant, the Sublandlord or either broker previously designated may request the Greater Boston Real Estate Board,
	Inc. to designate the third broker willing so to act and a broker so appointed shall, for all purposes, have the same standing and powers as though such broker had been seasonably appointed by the brokers first appointed. In case of the inability or
	refusal to serve of any person designated as a broker, or in case any broker for any reason ceases to be such, a broker to fill such vacancy shall be appointed by the Subtenant, the Sublandlord, the broker first appointed or the said Greater Boston
	Real Estate Board, Inc., as the case may be, whichever made the original appointment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	21.
<U>
	Return of Premises
</U>
	. Subtenant shall, at
	the expiration or termination of this Sublease, peaceably yield up the Subleased Premises in broom-clean condition, wear and tear, and damage by fire and other casualty excepted. Subtenant shall remove all cables and wires serving the Subleased
	Premises (to the extent installed by or on behalf of Subtenant and not existing in or serving the Subleased Premises as of the Sublease Term Commencement Date), but, provided Prime Landlord consents at the time it delivers the Consent, Subtenant
	shall not be responsible for the removal of the TI&nbsp;Work pursuant to Section&nbsp;5.1.9 of the Prime Lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	22.
<U>
	Miscellaneous
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A.
<U>
	Counterparts
</U>
	. This instrument may be signed in counterpart originals, which, taken together, shall constitute a single original
	instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	B.
<U>
	Notices
</U>
	. Notices to Sublandlord or Subtenant required or permitted hereunder shall be sent in the manner prescribed
	in the Prime Lease to the Premises in the case of notices to Sublandlord and in the case of notices to Subtenant as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Prior to the
	Sublease Term Commencement Date:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Chiasma
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	60 Wells Avenue, Suite 102
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Newton, MA 02459
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Attn: Mark J.
	Fitzpatrick
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	After the Sublease Term Commencement Date:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At the Subleased Premises
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:13%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Attn: Mark J. Fitzpatrick
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	C.
<U>
	Amendments
</U>
	. This Sublease may not be changed or terminated orally but only by an agreement in writing signed by both Sublandlord and Subtenant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	12
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage183"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	D.
<U>
	Estoppel Certificates
</U>
	. Sublandlord and Subtenant each agree to furnish within twenty
	(20)&nbsp;days after written request therefor by the other, a certificate stating (i)&nbsp;that this Sublease is in full force and effect and has not been amended or modified (or describing such amendment or modification, if any); (ii)&nbsp;the
	dates through which Base Rent and Subtenant Additional Rent have been paid hereunder; and (iii)&nbsp;that there are no defaults under this Sublease known to the signer of the certificate (or specifying such defaults, if known).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	E.
<U>
	No Waiver
</U>
	. The failure of either party to insist on strict performance of any covenant or condition hereof, or to exercise any
	option contained herein, shall not be construed as a waiver of such covenant, condition or option in any other instance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	F.
<U>
	Memorandum
	of Sublease
</U>
	. Subtenant shall not record this Sublease or any memorandum hereof. Subtenant may file this Sublease and it exhibits with the Securities and Exchange Commission if required by law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	G.
<U>
	Governing Law
</U>
	. This Sublease has been negotiated, executed and delivered in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, and the parties agree
	that the rights and obligations of the parties under this Sublease shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	H.
<U>
	Severability
</U>
	. The invalidity of any of the provisions of this Sublease will not impair or affect in any manner the validity,
	enforceability or effect of the rest of this Sublease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I.
<U>
	Entire Agreement
</U>
	. All understandings and agreements, oral or written,
	heretofore made between the parties hereto are merged in this Sublease, which alone fully and completely expresses the agreement between Sublandlord and Subtenant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	J.
<U>
	Relationship Between the Parties
</U>
	. This Sublease does not create the relationship of principal and agent, nor does it create any
	partnership, joint venture, or any association or relationship between Sublandlord and Subtenant other than as and to the extent specifically provided in this Sublease, the sole relationship of Sublandlord and Subtenant being that of sublandlord and
	subtenant as provided in this Sublease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	K.
<U>
	Remedies Cumulative
</U>
	. Except as specifically provided herein, all rights and remedies of
	Sublandlord under this Sublease shall be cumulative and none shall exclude any other rights and remedies allowed by law.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<I>
	[This Space
	Intentionally Left Blank]
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	13
</P>

<B>
	IN WITNESS WHEREOF
</B>
	, the parties have executed this Sublease as an instrument under seal as
	of the date first written above.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage187"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	EXHIBIT B
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Work Letter
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.
<U>
	Sublandlord&#146;s Work
</U>
	. This
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;B
</U>
	sets forth the obligations of Sublandlord and Subtenant with respect to the initial improvements to be performed in the Subleased Premises to prepare the same for Subtenant&#146;s use and
	occupancy. Sublandlord shall construct the initial improvements as shown on the Plans (as defined below) in accordance with the terms of this
<U>
	Exhibit&nbsp;B
</U>
	(&#147;
<B>
	Sublandlord&#146;s Work
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
<U>
	Plans
</U>
	. Subtenant&#146;s architect will prepare the initial test fit plan for the Sublandlord
<B>
	&#146;s
</B>
	Work at Subtenant&#146;s
	sole cost and expense;
<I>
	provided
</I>
	that Sublandlord shall provide an allowance in the amount of $1,920.00 for the purposes of the initial test fit plan. Subtenant shall, at its sole cost and expense, prepare or cause to be prepared, subject to
	approval by Sublandlord and Prime Landlord, final architectural, electrical and mechanical construction drawings, plans and specifications (collectively, the &#147;
<B>
	Plans
</B>
	&#148;) necessary to construct Sublandlord&#146;s Work, which plans shall
	comply with all Sublandlord&#146;s architect&#146;s and engineers&#146; requirements to avoid aesthetic or other conflicts with the design and function of the balance of the Building and be consistent with the initial test fit plan. Subtenant
	covenants and agrees to devote such time as may be reasonably necessary in consultation with said architect and engineers to enable them to complete and submit the final Plans to Sublandlord and Prime Landlord for approval. Time is of (he essence
	with respect to Subtenant&#146;s cooperation in the preparation, submission and approval of the Plans. Approval by Sublandlord of Sublandlord&#146;s Work and the Plans shall not constitute any warranty by Sublandlord to Subtenant of the adequacy of
	the design for Subtenant&#146;s intended use of the Subleased Premises nor shall Sublandlord&#146;s approval of the Plans create any liability or responsibility on the part of Sublandlord for compliance with applicable statutes, ordinances,
	regulations, laws, codes and industry standards relating to handicap discrimination (including, without limitation, the Americans with Disabilities Act).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<U>
	Working Drawings
</U>
	. If deemed necessary by Sublandlord for the performance of Sublandlord&#146;s Work, Subtenant, at its sole cost and
	expense (subject to the Subtenant Allowance provided for in Paragraph&nbsp;7), shall prepare final working drawings and specifications for Sublandlord&#146;s Work (the &#147;
<B>
	Working Drawings
</B>
	&#148;) based upon and consistent with the Plans and
	the plans, drawings, specifications, finish details and other information furnished by Subtenant to Sublandlord under Paragraph&nbsp;2 above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<U>
	Performance of Sublandlord&#146;s Work
</U>
	. Except as hereinafter provided to the contrary, Sublandlord shall perform Sublandlord&#146;s
	Work shown on the Plans and Working Drawings using Building standard materials and quantities as reasonably determined by Sublandlord (&#147;
<B>
	Building Standards
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.
<U>
	Substantial Completion
</U>
	. Sublandlord shall use reasonable efforts to cause Sublandlord&#146;s Work to be Substantially Completed (as
	defined in Section&nbsp;3(B) of the Sublease), subject to delays caused by Force Majeure (as defined below) and Subtenant Delays (as defined in Paragraph 6 below), on or before March&nbsp;15, 2016 (the &#147;
<B>
	Anticipated Substantial Completion
	Date
</B>
	&#148;). If Sublandlord&#146;s Work is not Substantially Completed on or before the Anticipated Substantial Completion Date (as extended), the Sublease shall remain in full force and effect; provided:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(i) The Sublease Term Commencement Date shall not occur until Sublandlord&#146;s Work is Substantially Completed, except as set forth in
	Section&nbsp;6 with respect to a Subtenant Delay,
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage188"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(ii) If Sublandlord does not deliver the Subleased Premises to Subtenant in the Delivery
	Condition with the Sublandlord Work Substantially Completed by April&nbsp;15, 2016 (the &#147;
<B>
	First Outside Date
</B>
	&#148;) and such failure to so deliver is not the result of Force Majeure or Subtenant Delay, then for each day thereafter until
	such time as the Subleased Premises are delivered to Subtenant in the Delivery Condition with the Sublandlord&#146;s Work Substantially Completed, Subtenant shall receive a rent credit equal to one day&#146;s Base Rent at the highest rental rate
	payable during the first Lease Year and after the initial ninety (90)&nbsp;days thereof which reflects a reduced rental rate; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(iii)
	In the event that Sublandlord does not deliver the Subleased Premises to Subtenant in the Delivery Condition with the Sublandlord&#146;s Work Substantially Completed by July&nbsp;12, 2016 (the &#147;
<B>
	Final Outside Date
</B>
	&#148;), and such failure
	to so deliver is not the result of Force Majeure (but the extension on account of Force Majeure shall not exceed 30 days) or Subtenant Delay, then Subtenant shall have the right to terminate this Sublease by written notice to Sublandlord at any time
	after the Final Outside Date but prior to the date that Sublandlord actually Substantially Completes the Sublandlord&#146;s Work and delivers the Premises in the Delivery Condition.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;
<B>
	Force Majeure
</B>
	&#148; shall mean events beyond Sublandlord&#146;s reasonable control, including, without limitation, accident;
	breakage; strike, lockout; act of terrorism; shortage of materials, which shortage is not unique to Sublandlord; governmental regulation, moratorium or other governmental action, inaction or delay; or fire, flood, unusually inclement weather,
	earthquake or other natural disaster.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.
<U>
	Subtenant Delay
</U>
	. In the event of a &#147;Subtenant Delay&#148;, defined below, the
	Sublease Term Commencement Date shall be deemed to be the date Sublandlord&#146;s Work would have been Substantially Completed absent Subtenant Delays, as reasonably determined by Sublandlord. &#147;Subtenant Delay&#148; shall mean an actual delay
	in the Sublandlord Work and to the extent such delay results from any of the following:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(i) the performance of any other work in the
	Subleased Premises by any person, firm or corporation employed by or on behalf of Subtenant, such as is contemplated under Section&nbsp;8 hereof, that actually delays Substantial Completion of Sublandlord&#146;s Work;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(ii) the failure of Subtenant to pay for the cost, if any, of Sublandlord&#146;s Work in excess of the Subtenant Allowance within the time
	periods set forth in Paragraph&nbsp;7 below;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(iii) the failure to approve recommended contractor and subcontractor selections within
	three (3)&nbsp;business days after request by Sublandlord, the timing of which shall not be required earlier than the date by which Subtenant is to approve the Project Cost Estimate, as provided in Section&nbsp;7 below;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage189"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(iv) the failure to approve the Project Cost Estimate by December&nbsp;4,2015 (or, if later, the
	date that is five (5)&nbsp;days after the Project Cost Estimate is initially delivered to Subtenant); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(v) any other act or omission
	of Subtenant which results in actual delay in the Substantial Completion of Sublandlord&#146;s Work, provided Sublandlord advised Subtenant of such act or omission within two (2)&nbsp;business days after the occurrence thereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7.
<U>
	Cost of Sublandlord&#146;s Work; Subtenant Allowance
</U>
	. Sublandlord shall complete Sublandlord&#146;s Work at Subtenant&#146;s
	expense, except that Sublandlord shall contribute to Subtenant an allowance of up to $1,920,000.00 (the &#147;
<B>
	Subtenant Allowance
</B>
	&#148;). Promptly following Sublandlord&#146;s written approval of the Plans, and, if applicable, the Working
	Drawings, Sublandlord shall deliver a &#147;
<B>
	Project Cost Estimate
</B>
	&#148; to Subtenant, reflecting the best prices resulting from Sublandlord&#146;s bidding process. The Project Cost Estimate will include the costs to install the
	Subtenant&#146;s structured tel/data wiring and cabling in the Subleased Premises as hard costs (but not &#147;dynamic cabling&#148; or patching, within and between racks, such work being the responsibility of Subtenant). In connection with
	Sublandlord&#146;s Project Cost Estimate, Sublandlord&#146;s general contractor shall obtain a minimum of three (3)&nbsp;bids for all major subtrades. Promptly following Sublandlord&#146;s delivery of same, Subtenant may either approve the Project
	Cost Estimate or request that changes be made to the final Plan, and, if applicable, the Working Drawings (subject to Sublandlord&#146;s and Prime Landlord&#146;s approval) for the purpose of lowering the total project cost. If Subtenant fails to
	deliver either its written approval of, or its written request for modifications to, any Project Cost Estimate within five (5)&nbsp;business days following delivery by Sublandlord, Subtenant shall be deemed to have approved the Project Cost Estimate
	in its entirety. Once Sublandlord and Subtenant have approved me Project Cost Estimate (or the Project Cost Estimate is deemed approved), the parties shall execute an instrument confirming the amount of the final Project Cost Estimate. Sublandlord
	shall accept the lowest bids for the Sublandlord Work unless Subtenant otherwise approves. The Sublandlord&#146;s Work shall be performed on an open book basis, on the basis of a guaranteed maximum price contract.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If the sum of the final Project Cost Estimate and Subtenant&#146;s Soft Costs exceeds the Subtenant Allowance, Subtenant shall be entitled to
	the Subtenant Allowance in accordance with the terms hereof, but the timing of each individual disbursement of the Subtenant Allowance shall be disbursed in the proportion that the Subtenant Allowance bears to the total cost for Sublandlord&#146;s
	Work (
<I>
	e.g.
</I>
	,&nbsp;if the Subtenant Allowance equals 80% of the Project Cost Estimate, then Sublandlord shall disburse a portion of the Subtenant Allowance equal to 80% of the costs covered by each requisition, up to the aggregate amount of the
	Subtenant Allowance). In all events, Subtenant shall pay Sublandlord all costs of Sublandlord Work in excess of the Subtenant Allowance. Subtenant shall be allowed to use up to ten percent (10%)&nbsp;of the Subtenant Allowance toward the following
	(&#147;
<B>
	Subtenants Soft Costs
</B>
	&#148;): toward the Project Management Fee and, to the extent the Subtenant Allowance exceeds the cost of Sublandlord&#146;s Work and the Project Management Fee, toward architectural, engineering and project
	management fees and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage190"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	costs (which in the aggregate shall not exceed $150,000) and toward costs related to moving. As used herein, &#147;
<B>
	Project Management Fee
</B>
	&#148; shall mean the fee to be paid by Subtenant
	to Sublandlord in the amount of four percent (4%)&nbsp;of the hard construction costs, which Project Management fee shall be deducted from the Subtenant Allowance with each draw. In consideration of the Project Management Fee, Sublandlord shall not
	charge Subtenant for any fees or expenses to review the Plans.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event Sublandlord receives from its general contractor a change
	order request that would increase the cost of Sublandlord&#146;s Work, Sublandlord shall deliver a copy of such change order request to Subtenant Subtenant shall approve or reject the proposed change order within two (2)&nbsp;business days after
	delivery thereof, with Subtenant&#146;s failure to reject the proposed change order in writing being deemed an election to accept the change order. If Subtenant rejects the proposed change order, Sublandlord and Subtenant and the general contractor
	shall meet to discuss the change order and will attempt to reach a resolution as to any dispute. If, by the date that is four (4)&nbsp;business days after the delivery of the proposed change order to Subtenant, no resolution has been reached, then
	notwithstanding Subtenant&#146;s objections, Sublandlord shall be free to accept the proposed change order.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.
<U>
	Subtenant Access
</U>
	.
	Sublandlord, upon request by Subtenant, shall grant to Subtenant and Subtenant&#146;s agents a license to enter the Subleased Premises at any time from and after the date which Sublandlord reasonably determines to be sixty (60)&nbsp;days prior to
	the date Sublandlord&#146;s Work will be Substantially Completed for the purposes of installing Subtenant&#146;s cabling, audiovisual equipment, furniture and fixtures in the Subleased Premises. It shall be a condition to the grant by Sublandlord
	and continued effectiveness of such license that:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) Subtenant&#146;s request for such early access shall be accompanied by: (i)&nbsp;a
	description of and schedule for the work to be performed by those persons and entities for whom such access is being requested; (ii)&nbsp;the names and addresses of all contractors for whom such early access is being requested and copies of all
	licenses and permits required in connection with the performance of the work for which such access is being requested; and (iii)&nbsp;certificates of insurance (in amounts and with insured parties satisfactory to Sublandlord). All of the foregoing
	shall be subject to Sublandlord approval in its sole discretion.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) Such early access for installation purposes shall be subject to
	reasonable scheduling by Sublandlord.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) Subtenant&#146;s agents, contractors, workmen, mechanics, suppliers and invitees shall work in
	harmony and not interfere with (i)&nbsp;Sublandlord and Sublandlord&#146;s agents in performing Sublandlord&#146;s Work or any additional tenant improvement work in the Subleased Premises or work by Sublandlord or its agents in other premises or
	common areas of the Building, or (ii)&nbsp;the general operation of the Building. If at any time such entry shall cause or reasonably threaten to cause such disharmony or interference, Sublandlord may withdraw such license immediately upon written
	notice to Subtenant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any such entry into and occupation of the Subleased Premises by Subtenant shall be deemed to be under all of the
	terms, covenants, conditions and provisions of the Sublease
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage191"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(including, without limitation, the insurance and indemnity provisions therein), except that Base Rent and Subtenant Additional Rent shall not be payable until the date set forth in
	Section&nbsp;4 of the Sublease (Subtenant&#146;s obligation to pay electricity hereunder shall commence upon Subtenant occupying the Subleased Premises). Sublandlord shall not be liable for any injury, loss or damage which may occur to any of
	Subtenant&#146;s work or installations made in the Subleased Premises or to property placed therein prior to the commencement of the Sublease Term, the same being at Subtenant&#146;s sole risk and liability. Subtenant shall be liable to Sublandlord
	for any damage to the Subleased Premises or to any portion of Sublandlord&#146;s Work caused by Subtenant or any of Subtenant&#146;s employees, agents, contractors, workmen or suppliers. In the event the performance of the work by Subtenant, its
	agents, employees or contractors causes material extra costs to Sublandlord, Subtenant shall reimburse Sublandlord for the entire documented extra cost and the cost incurred by Sublandlord for the engineers or operators under applicable union
	regulations or contracts.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.
<U>
	Incorporation
</U>
	. The terms and provisions of the Sublease, insofar as they are applicable to this Work
	Letter, are hereby incorporated herein by reference.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.
<U>
	Additional Rent
</U>
<I>
	.
</I>
	All amounts payable by Subtenant to Sublandlord
	hereunder shall be deemed to be Subtenant Additional Rent under the Sublease and upon any default in the payment of same. Sublandlord shall have all of the rights and remedies provided for in the Sublease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11.
<U>
	Limitation
</U>
	. This Exhibit shall not be deemed applicable to any additional space added to the Subleased Premises at any time or from
	time to time, whether by any options under the Sublease or otherwise, or to any portion of the original Subleased Premises or any additions to the Subleased Premises in the event of a renewal or extension of the Sublease Term of the Sublease,
	whether by any options under the Sublease or otherwise, unless expressly so provided in the Sublease or any amendment or supplement to the Sublease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	5
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage192"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	EXHIBIT C
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Form of Fitness Center Waiver and Release
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	WAIVER AND RELEASE
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I,
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, understand and accept that there are certain dangers and health risks in the use of the fitness center located at
	275&nbsp;Wyman Street, Waltham, Massachusetts (the &#147;
<B>
	Fitness Center
</B>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Accordingly, I hereby release Cimpress USA
	Incorporated, VistaPrint Limited, 275&nbsp;Wyman LLC, and each of their respective agents, representatives and attorneys including, without limitation, the directors and officers of each of Cimpress USA Incorporated, VistaPrint Limited, and
	275&nbsp;Wyman LLC (each of them being included among the &#147;
<B>
	Released Parties
</B>
	&#148;), from any and all liability, loss, damage, costs, claims and/or causes of action including, but not limited to, negligence by any of the Released Parties
	and all claims for bodily injuries and/or property damage which I may suffer as a result of my use of the Fitness Center.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	By giving this
	Waiver and Release, I fully acknowledge the potential risk involved in my use of the Fitness Center. I also represent that I do not have any medical condition which may impair, compromise or otherwise prohibit my use of the Fitness Center.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I hereby attest that I am of legal age to execute this Waiver and Release. I also understand that because this is a Waiver and Release, before
	signing it, I acknowledge that I have had the opportunity to review this Waiver and Release with an attorney of my own choosing before deciding to sign it.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Date: &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 20&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Signature
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage193"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	EXHIBIT D
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Form of Letter of Credit
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<I>
	[Letterhead of a money center bank acceptable to the Landlord]
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<I>
	[Please note the tenant on this Letter of Credit must match the exact tenant entity in the Lease]
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	[date]
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cimpress USA Incorporated
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	300 Shire Way
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Lexington, MA 02421
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Attn:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Ladies and Gentlemen:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We hereby establish our Irrevocable Letter of Credit and authorize you to draw on us at sight for the account of Chiasma, Inc., a Delaware
	corporation (&#147;
<B>
	Applicant
</B>
	&#148;), the aggregate amount of Four Hundred Fifty Thousand and 00/100 Dollars (S450,OGO.QO). You shall have the right to make partial draws against this Letter of Credit from time to time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Funds under this Letter of Credit are available to the beneficiary hereof as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any or all of the sums hereunder may be drawn down at any time and from time Jo time from and after the date hereof by Cimpress USA
	Incorporated, a Delaware corporation (&#147;
<B>
	Beneficiary
</B>
	&#148;) when accompanied by this Letter of Credit and a written statement signed by an individual purporting to be an authorized agent of Beneficiary, certifying that such moneys are due
	and owing to Beneficiary, and a sight draft executed and endorsed by such individual.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Letter of Credit is transferable in its
	entirety to any successor in interest to Beneficiary as lessee of 275&nbsp;Wyman Street, Waltham, Massachusetts. Should a transfer be desired, such transfer will be subject to the return to us of this advice, together with written instructions. Any
	fees related to such transfer shall be for the account of the Applicant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The amount of each draft must be endorsed on the reverse hereof
	by the negotiating bank. We hereby agree that this Letter of Credit shall be duly honored upon presentation and delivery of the certification specified above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Letter of Credit shall expire
	[&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;] [sixty (60)&nbsp;days following the expiration of the Sublease Term].
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the above expiration date of this Letter of Credit, the term of this Letter of Credit shall be automatically renewed for
	successive, additional one (1)&nbsp;year periods unless, at least sixty (60)&nbsp;days prior to any such date of expiration, the undersigned shall give written notice to Beneficiary, by certified mail, return receipt requested and at the address set
	forth above or at such other address as may be given to the undersigned by Beneficiary, that this Letter of Credit will not be renewed.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage194"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If any instructions accompanying a drawing under this Letter of Credit request that payment is to
	be made by transfer to your account with another bank, we will only effect such payment by fed wire to a U.S. regulated bank, and we and/or such other bank may rely on an account number specified in such instructions even if the number identifies a
	person or entity different from the intended payee.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Letter of Credit is governed by the Uniform Customs and Practice for Documentary
	Credits (1993 Revision), International Chamber of Commerce Publication 500.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
