<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Sagan House,
	Weizmann Institute of Science, 234 Herzl St. Rehovot
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Dear sirs,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Re:
<U>
<B>
	Bank Guarantee
</B>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	According to
	the request of &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (hereinafter: the &#147;Tenant&#148;) we hereby undertake and are liable towards you to pay any sum under the
	limit of &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; NIS (in words:
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; NIS) when this sum is linked to the consumer price index (including vegetables and fruit) that is published by the Central
	Bureau of Statistics when the base index is the index of the month of &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; year
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; - (hereinafter the &#147;Guarantee Sum&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We undertake to pay you any sum that shall be demanded by you under the limit of the guarantee sum immediately upon your first written demand, and no later
	than two business days after the day of demand, and without you having to base or prove your demand. Any sum that shall be paid by us as mentioned, shall be divided between you so that Africa Israel Properties Ltd. and Ef- Shar Ltd. shall be
	entitled (together) to 60% of such payment and the Weizmann Institute of Science shall be entitled to 40% of such payment.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	You shall be entitled to
	demand payment of the entire guarantee sum from us or demand from us from time to time sums on account of the guarantee sum, and in this case the guarantee shall remain in force regarding the balance of the guarantee sums after each payment,
	provided that the total sum of your demands shall not exceed the guarantee sum.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This guarantee shall be in full force up to the
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; at 12:00 inclusive, and any demand according to it must be given to us by no later than this time.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage267"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Appendix &#147;F&#148;
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Procedure of Working with Heat
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Waste materials, empty boxes, crates and wood and paper waste shall be removed from the Leased Property by the Tenant each day and they shall be stored at a safe distance from it, in the sites intended for this in the
	park.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	No &#147;work with heat&#148; shall be performed in the area of the Leased Property at a radius of 10 meters from any flammable material not in accordance with the procedure set forth hereafter:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The term &#147;work with heat&#148; means: performing any work while using welding and/or cutting with heat and/or using open fire.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Any contractor or sub- contractor whose work involves &#147;working with heat&#148; shall appoint a supervisor (hereinafter: &#147;Supervisor&#148;) whose duty it shall be to ascertain that no work with heat shall be
	performed not in accordance with the provisions in this procedure.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Before commencing the performance of any work with heat, the supervisor shall survey the area that is intended for performing the work with heat, and ascertain that flammable material of any type is removed from the
	area in a radius of at least 10 meters from the place of performing the work with heat, when fixed flammable objects, that cannot be moved, shall be covered with an fireproof cover.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The supervisor shall appoint a person that shall serve as a fire scout (hereinafter: &#147;Fire Scout&#148;) who is equipped with fire extinguishing means which are suitable to extinguish types of flammable materials
	that are in the surroundings of the place where work with heat is being performed (but no less than two 6 kilogram sprinklers which are in good working order at the time of performing the welding work). The sole job of the fire scout shall be to
	observe the performance of the work with heat and to immediately put out any fire that erupts that could be due to performing the work with heat.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.5.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A fire scout shall be present in the place of performing the work with heat starting from the commencement of their performance and up to the end of 30 minutes at least after their completion, in order to ascertain that
	no sources of combustion have remained.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage268"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Appendix &#147;G&#148;
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Rules for the Supply of Electricity
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	1.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Introduction
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The provisions of this appendix shall apply to the Tenant and shall bind him
	insofar as in the building where the Leased Property is located the Landlord provides electricity services as defined hereafter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This appendix set forth
	the mutual undertakings of the parties with respect to the supply of electricity services to the Leased Property as defined hereafter.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following
	terms shall be given the meaning set forth at their side as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_45"></A>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Property&#148; -
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	the area leased to the Tenant by the Landlord according to this agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">

	the supply of electricity, maintenance of electrical installations that shall be installed in the building and in the Leased Property by the Landlord, insurance of these electrical installations, operating and maintaining the
	electricity control system in the building and its installations, except for the electricity installations that shall be installed in the Leased Property by the Tenant.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	General
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All the electricity services to the Leased Property shall be provided by the Landlord.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The charge of the Tenant for the supply of electricity services, shall be made on a basis of a readout of the electricity meter, which shall measure the supply of electricity to the Leased Property, and in addition to
	charges for use of the common electricity installations, insurance of the electricity installations, maintenance of the electricity installations etc&#133; all as set forth hereafter in this appendix.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant declares and undertakes to use only the electricity services supply that shall be supplied by the Landlord and not turn to the Electric Corp. with a request to install a separate meter and/or separate supply
	and/or direct supply of electricity and/or direct payment to the Electric Corp. and the Tenant shall bear all the Landlord&#146;s damage in such case. The aforesaid does not derogate from the right of the Israel Electric Corp. Ltd. to connect the
	Tenant directly to the electricity network and to the electricity supply that is given on behalf of the Electric Corp. and this is according to its exclusive discretion in coordination with the Landlord.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage269"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Tenant shall not have any claim for any cause of action against the Electric Corp. for the
	failure to supply an electricity current and/or disturbances in its supply, including with respect to electronic equipment or otherwise that shall be installed by the Tenant, if installed, in the Leased Property, and the Tenant undertakes to
	indemnify the Electric Corp. for any cost and damage that shall be caused to it as a result of a claim for the issues as mentioned of any guest and/or authorized person on behalf of the Tenant.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Landlord shall provide to the Tenant electricity services to the Landlord, when the manner of using the electricity in the Leased Property itself shall be according to the Tenant&#146;s discretion, subject to any
	law and/or term and/or rules dealing with electricity and the use of it, subject to the other provisions of this appendix.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	e.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant undertakes to sign the undertakings attached as appendix &#147;G1&#148; towards the Electric Corp. A breach of this undertaking is the same as a breach of the lease agreement for all intents and purposes.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	f.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Without derogating from the aforesaid, the Tenant is aware that the supply of electricity in bulk is given to the entire building as a whole and any change of the supply method and the transfer to individual supply is
	subject and conditional inter alia, to the transfer of the entire building as a whole without any exception, including all the renters at the same time, to another method, all in accordance and subject to the terms in the agreement that was signed
	between the Landlord and the Electric Corp.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Imputing Payments
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Landlord has the right to determine at the time of
	performing any payment by the Tenant, according to its sole discretion, the charge for which the sum that was paid shall be imputed to his account. In order to avoid doubt, as long as the Landlord has not notified the Tenant otherwise, each payment
	that the Tenant shall make according to the agreement and its appendixes shall be first imputed for rent, afterwards for maintenance fees and afterwards for electricity, and afterwards for the other costs according to their order.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Checking the Electrical Installations in the Leased Property
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Landlord shall be entitled to visit the Leased Property at any reasonable time, without the need for an advance notice, and to check each electrical installation to examine its safety, and its compatibility with
	acceptable safety standards.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the engineer shall think that any electrical installation that was installed in the Leased Property could cause damage to the general electricity supply system in the building and/or that has safety risks and hazards
	and/or that does not comply with the acceptable safety standards and/or that the burden that it imposes on the electricity services supply system that could disrupt the system &#150; the engineer shall be entitled to demand a repair or replacement
	and/or change of the installation, and the Tenant undertakes to take all the means necessary for fulfilling the engineer&#146;s demand within 14 days.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant shall be responsible for any damage that shall be caused to the equipment and/or to the electricity installations in the Leased Property and/or in the electricity system outside of the Leased Property as a
	result of operating an electricity installation that is not in good working order, as set forth above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage270"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	5.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Changes and Additions in the Electricity System
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Tenant is not entitled to
	perform expansions and/or changes and/or additions in the electricity supply installations that shall be supplied to the Leased Property, and the Landlord shall be entitled to immediately disconnect and/or remove any expansion, change addition
	etc&#133; that were made without the Landlord&#146;s permission. Such disconnection and/or removal as mentioned shall be made at the Tenant&#146;s expense, and this is without derogating from the Tenant&#146;s liability for any damage that shall be
	caused to the electricity supply installations as a result of the work as mentioned.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any change, expansion and/or addition to the
	electricity supply installations that shall be required by the Tenant beyond the provisions in the contract are conditioned upon receiving the Landlord&#146;s prior written approval and if they shall be approved by the Landlord &#150; they shall be
	changed payment that shall apply to the Tenant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the aforesaid it is clarified that in a one- time and unusual manner the
	Tenant shall be entitled to make changes in the electricity installations in the Leased Property except in the main electricity board and except in any electricity installation that is a public system or a system that supplies the Leased Property,
	for the purpose of adjusting the Leased Property for the Tenant&#146;s purposes in accordance with the purpose of the lease through a certified electricity consultant, and this only. The Tenant undertakes that after performing the changes and before
	re- connecting to the main electricity board, to present before the Landlord an approval of a certified electricity examiner according to which all the actions the changes that the Tenant has made comply with the binding standards and requirements.
	Re- connecting to the main electricity board shall be subject to receiving the Landlord&#146;s approval for that.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Access and Caring for the Electricity Installations
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant shall permit access to any authorized employee on behalf of the Landlord during any reasonable hour, to any electricity installation in the Leased Property, for examining, inspecting, installing, repairing,
	replacing faulty parts, removing, dismantling, compiling etc&#133; work that shall be required according to the Landlord in the electricity installations that supply the electricity services to the Leased Property.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For performing the work as mentioned, the Landlord shall be entitled to temporarily disconnect for the time that shall be required, the supply of electricity to the Leased Property, provided that the duration of time in
	which the electricity supply shall be disconnected to the Leased Property shall be reasonable, taking into consideration the type of work in the Leased Property.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant shall make sure to turn and/or move any installation that disturbs access in order to perform the work as mentioned above.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	7.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Ownership Rights
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any machine, tool and other equipment that are connected to the
	electricity supply services system that were installed by the Landlord, are the Landlord&#146;s exclusive property, and it is not relevant whether the Tenant has participated in the purchase costs and/or installation costs and/or connection costs of
	this equipment or not.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage271"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	8.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Liability for the Landlord&#146;s Property
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant shall be barred from performing any work of any type and kind, in machines, tools and other equipment that belongs to the electricity supply services system to the Leased Property, unless it received a prior
	written approval from the Landlord, to perform the work as mentioned, was not by the Landlord.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant shall be responsible to safeguard the equipment described above and its intactness, during the entire lease period, and/or the use of the Leased Property, and he shall be responsible towards the Landlord for
	any damage that shall be caused to the equipment, that is not such that arises from reasonable wear and tear that was created despite careful and reasonable use of the equipment.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant undertakes not to make any change in the public electricity systems that supply the Leased Property.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	9.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Delivery of Electricity
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Tenant is not entitled to supply and/or sell
	electricity and/or give any electricity services that were provided to him by the Landlord, for consideration or without consideration and in any other manner, unless this is about the supply of electricity within the area of the Leased Property, to
	other authorized parties according to the agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	10.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Limiting the Landlord&#146;s Liability in the Event of Electricity Outages
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Landlord shall be entitled to stop or to limit the supply of electricity services to the Leased Property and to other places in the building, in the cases set forth hereafter:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In any event of a cessation or limit in the electricity supply due to an internal malfunction and/or external malfunction to the main electricity services supply in the building, such as national power outages or
	regional power outages, due to the system or the Electric Corp. or in the internal electricity distribution system of the building.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	ii.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In any other event, in which the engineer shall order the need for such cessation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In any event, in which it shall be possible to notify the Tenant of a suspected cessation in the supply of electricity services, a notice of this shall be given in advance from the Landlord, in a manner that shall be
	determined by the Landlord.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Landlord shall not be responsible and it shall not bear any damage that shall be caused to the Tenant for power cessations, in the cases set forth above, and/or in any other case that the Landlord has no control
	over.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	11.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Unexpected Changes
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If as a result of the law, regulation, order to action of a
	government authority or other authorized authority, there shall be a need, according to the Landlord&#146;s discretion, to perform any changes in the electricity supply system to the Leased Property, the Landlord shall perform these changes without
	the Tenant meeting any claim and/or lawsuit for performing such change, and the Tenant shall bear the costs as a result of such work.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage272"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	12.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Determining the Electricity Supplier for the Leased Property
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The quantity of the power supply used in the Leased Property is part of the components for which usage fees shall be paid by the Tenant, in consideration for the supply of electricity services.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The quantity of the power supply (in kilowatts) that the Tenant shall consume in the Leased Property shall be measured by a separate meter that shall be installed in the concentration of the meters in the building
	and/or in a place that the Landlord shall determine in the building.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The readout of the meter shall be made by the employees authorized on behalf of the Landlord or by computerized electronic means and this shall serve as absolute testimony with respect to the quantity of electricity
	that was consumed.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the event the meter did not operate in good working order for a certain period, or it did not work at all, due to a malfunction or for any other reason, or in the event that the Tenant consumed electricity in the
	Leased Property not through the meter or in a manner that is not agreed according to the agreement and this appendix, a calculation shall be made by the Landlord of the consumption quantity in this time frame mentioned by way of an assessment,
	according to the rate of consumption in prior periods, and in the event that this is not possible, an assessment shall be made by way of comparing the consumption in similar businesses in the building.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	e.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the event that the Tenant shall dispute the Landlord&#146;s assessments as set forth above, the engineer shall determine this matter, and his decision shall be final and binding.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	f.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In any other case, in which the Tenant shall dispute the quantity of the electricity consumption in the Leased Property, the claim shall be checked by the authorized employees on behalf of the Landlord, and if it shall
	be found in this examination that there was an inaccuracy in the calculation, for a reason that is not dependent on the Tenant, the calculation shall be amended, and the Tenant shall be accredited or charged respectively, in the account afterwards,
	in the sum that is due from amending the error.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	g.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In any event of an examination that shall be made according to the Tenant&#146;s request as mentioned above, in which it shall be found that there is no basis to the Tenant&#146;s claims, and that all the equipment that
	shall be installed by the Landlord is in good working order, the Tenant shall be required to bear the costs of the inspection, in the sum that shall be determined from time to time by the Landlord.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Cessation of the Electricity Services within the Lease Period
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the event of a material breach of the agreement, and especially if the Tenant has not paid the rent due from him, the Landlord is entitled to disconnect the electricity supply to the Tenant and this is after giving a
	written warning.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the event of the cessation of electricity as mentioned, all the costs the damage, and the losses for such cessation shall be under the Tenant&#146;s responsibility alone.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage273"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	14.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Cessation of the Supply of Electricity Services at the End of the Lease Period
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upon seizing possession in the Leased Property by the Landlord after the Tenant has vacated the Leased Property at the end of the lease period,
	or following any other event in which the Tenant has vacated the Leased Property, and has ceased to use it, whether according to the agreement or following its breach, the meter connected to the Leased Property shall be read and the readout of it
	shall be written. This readout shall serve for the final calculation between the parties in respect to the calculation of the payment that is due from the Tenant to the Landlord for the supply of electricity services.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	15.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<U>
	Payment for the Supply of Electricity Services
</U>
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The payment that the Tenant shall pay to the Landlord for the supply of electricity services shall be in accordance with the tariffs of the Israel Electric Corp. Ltd. for the supply of electricity in the low voltage
	tariff based on load and time.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Tenant shall be required to pay to the Landlord the cost price of using the electricity services as set forth above, according to an account that shall be submitted to the Tenant once per month.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The payment for the supply of electricity shall be collected together with the rent and/or the service fees and in a manner in which the service fees and/or the rent is collected, or in payment that shall be made
	directly to the Landlord&#146;s and/or the management company&#146;s account, as shall be given from time to time on the bills for payment, at the time that shall be delivered by the Landlord, all in accordance with the instructions that the
	Landlord shall give in accordance with its discretion. The provisions of section 7.3 of the agreement shall also apply with respect to the payment for the supply of electricity.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The bank guarantee and any other security that the Tenant has deposited with the Landlord and/or the management company at the time of signing this agreement, shall serve as a security for the payment of the sum due to
	the Landlord from the Tenant, for the supply of electricity services for the duration of the current charge period, and a security for the Tenant&#146;s liability to safeguard the electricity equipment that was supplied by the Landlord, and the
	Landlord shall be entitled, according to its choice, to use the guarantee and/or part of it and/or the additional security for covering any sum that shall be due to it from the Tenant, for using the electricity services. If the Landlord has used the
	guarantee, all or in part, the Tenant shall be required, immediately upon being required to do so, to renew and/or fill in what is missing in the guarantee. Giving the guarantee as mentioned shall not harm any other right of the Landlord, in
	accordance with any law and according to the contract and this appendix.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	16.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All the installations, the equipment, the systems etc&#133; connected to the supply of electricity services to the building in general and specifically to the Leased Property that was leased to the Tenant, shall be
	planned according to the best discretion of skilled professionals in this field, on behalf of the Landlord, and in the nature, quality, quantity, size, and type etc&#133; as shall be determined by those professionals.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage274"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Appendix &#147;H&#148;
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	Guarantee
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We the undersigned:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; identity
	certificate no. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; of &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; St.
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; identity certificate no. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; of
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; St. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Jointly and separately, personally and irrevocable guarantee the full and accurate performance of all the Tenant&#146;s undertakings according to the
	agreement above (hereinafter the &#147;Contract&#148;) towards the Landlord and towards the management company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This guarantee shall also apply to any
	change, amendment, addition, appendix, consent and waiver of any of the Tenant&#146;s undertakings, including transferring obligations and rights, on which it shall be agreed between the Tenant and the Landlord and/or the management company, without
	any of them having any obligation to notify us of this in advance or receive our consent for this.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We hereby waive towards the Landlord and/or the
	management company as defined in this agreement any requirement by virtue of the law to approach the Tenant as defined in this agreement before the Landlord and/or the management company turns to us for exercising this guarantee of ours. Any request
	to the Tenant shall be considered automatically as a request to us for the provisions of any law and we undertake to indemnify the Landlord and/or the management company for any of the Tenant&#146;s undertakings as mentioned in this agreement,
	including payment of compensation and damages, as if we are directly responsible towards the Landlord.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the sake of avoiding doubt: This guarantee of
	ours shall remain valid up to the end of 180 days after the lease period according to the agreement, including the extended lease period, and it shall remain in full force regarding all the Tenant&#146;s undertakings according to the contract also
	if the Landlord and/or the management company shall choose to act personally act against part of the guarantors together with any of us and/or in the event that the Landlord and/or the management company shall settle with the Tenant and/or with any
	of the guarantors personally and/or in the event that the Tenant and/or any of the guarantors shall be exempt from any undertaking towards the Landlord.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We are aware that giving the guarantee by us is a prerequisite to the Landlord&#146;s consent to enter into the lease agreement above.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the sake of avoiding doubt: by signing this guarantee we expressly subjugate ourselves also to the jurisdiction clause included in this agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	And in witness whereof we have signed &#150;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Specification for tenants who carry out the work accordingly &#150; attachment D.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	specification is an appendix.

	be converted into office floors, at the sole decision of the company.

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Permanent load: 100
	kg/m
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	2
</SUP>
	for partition walls, systems, acoustic ceilings. (Construction of plasterboard partitions only shall be permitted.)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Working load: 300 kg/m
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	2
</SUP>
	.

</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.4.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Electricity systems, sprinklers, fire detection systems in accordance with the requirements of the authorities and the needs of the equipment in the room.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.4.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Gate that rises or rolls at the entrance and a side entry door.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.5
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Generator
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An emergency generator shall be installed in the building, of a size as
	determined by the electrical consultant. The generator shall supply the loads of all the public emergency systems only. If required, the option exists to purchase an additional generator for tenants and some of the tenants shall be permitted to
	lease part of the generator in order to provide backup for systems in their area.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the aforesaid the tenants shall be required to pay
	the proportional part in the cost of purchasing the generator in accordance with their proportional part in the size of the backup allocated to them, including the proportional part in the electrical infrastructures and the accompanying work. The
	cost of installation of the electrical system, from the generator distribution board located in the generator room up to the interior of the property, including that required in the electricity boards of the tenants and inside the office areas shall
	apply to the tenants.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The decision regarding which of the tenants may exercise this option shall lie with the company only, and, subject
	to the surplus generator capacity and, without limitation to the
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage280"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	aforesaid, subject to the receipt of approval from the lessor (including regarding the location), the lessee shall be entitled to install a generator for its use on the roof of the building. The
	aforesaid shall be done in accordance with the provisions of section 12 of the leasing agreement, at the full expense and responsibility of the lessee.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_55"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.10.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The doors of the floor lobby shall be made in accordance with the requirements of the fire service for separation of fire or smoke from the rest of the floor. These separation doors are of a type approved by the fire
	service and may not be designed by the tenant. Water screens may be fitted above the aforesaid doors, that the tenant may remove.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	2.10.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	An atrium open to the entire height of the building, as well as steel bridges connecting the wings of the building.
</TD>
</TR>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	2.13
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	External walls
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The external envelope shall be designed by the architect. The finish
	materials are:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_58"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.13.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Prefabricated walls with stone cladding and aluminum windows. Concrete elements covered in aluminum sheet and aluminum curtain walls with windows.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.13.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the prefabricated walls the windows shall have an opening mechanism of the drei-kip type. In the curtain walls the windows shall open outwards to the kip position.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.13.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The windows shall have double glazing.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On every floor emergency exit windows shall be
	installed, as determined by the fire service, that shall be used by all tenants of the floor. These windows shall normally be locked. A key for the windows shall be provided.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	General systems
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	There shall pass through the office areas piping systems and channels for central supplies and/or supplies to various tenants on the floor, such as vertical and horizontal pipes for rain water, air conditioner drainage,
	horizontal channels for fresh air and the removal of smoke, ventilation of toilets, etc. The tenant does not have the right to change, move, connect or damage systems, either in the public areas or within the area of the office without approval from
	the company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage283"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Air conditioning system &#150; There are no concealment areas on the floors. For service rooms, there is the option of locating the condenser on the roof of the building (subject to consideration of acoustics, weight,
	sealing, etc.).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The air conditioning for the office floors shall be designed for the following conditions:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_60"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Summer temperature &#150; Outside: dry bulb temperature of 100 F, wet bulb temperature of 77 F. Inside: dry bulb temperature of 74 F, without humidity control.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Winter temperature &#150; Outside: dry bulb temperature of 40 F. inside: dry bulb temperature of 72 F, without humidity control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Design loads &#150; lighting: 20 W, instruments: 30 W.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The cooling output in the tenant&#146;s area shall be designed for a cooling capacity of 1 ton of cooling for every 20 m
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	2
</SUP>
	net area of offices.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_61"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The air conditioning installation shall be based on water cooling units, with air condensation, that shall be installed on the roof of the building and shall supply cold water on every floor in a central point. The
	tenant shall complete the water piping supply system and the coil fan units, that shall be connected to the central cooling system.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Heating shall be done using electrical heating elements in the units. The cooling units shall operate during regular working hours to be
	defined by the management company and as required, even 7/24 if there is a requirement for this. (The tenant shall be charged in accordance with a reading of the energy meter that shall calculate the cost of production and distribution of the energy
	in accordance with the actual consumption during the aforesaid times.)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Every lessee shall install, as part of the modification work, an
	energy meter of a type approved by the company and shall connect it to the control and metering system, that shall measure the energy consumed by the tenant, and charge him accordingly.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_62"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A cooling tower shall be installed on the roof that shall operate 7/24 and supply cooled water to all the floors, especially the ground floor. Tenants who wish to do so may connect to it the servers rooms systems, the
	commercial area, if any, on the ground floor. The tenant/ the contractor for the construction work in the leased premises shall supply in the rooms units of the water source type. The water tower is backed up by a generator.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:24%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Air conditioning shall be supplied to the tenants 24 hours a day, as set forth in section 3.1.3, by means of the water tower, using central
	water piping on the floor. The tenant shall connect to this piping, piping to supply his units. All the costs of operation of the system shall be divided between the tenants in accordance with a specified key and in accordance with their
	proportional part in the connection to the system.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_63"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Filtered and conditioned fresh air shall be supplied to the leased premises by means of main units located on the roof of the building, and main steel sheet channels in shafts. The tenant shall be responsible for
	completion of the steel sheet channels from the main exit point on the floor and inside the leased premises.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage284"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	At the core and envelope stage all the major systems shall be executed inside the building, including main piping and fresh air channels, up to a number of points on each floor. Inside the unit and/or from the end point
	made in the public framework, the systems shall be made by the tenant and in accordance with his design.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Preparation shall be made for drainage of air conditioners by means of vertical receptors in a number of places that are accessible. These receptors shall be intended for drainage of the air conditioners only and may
	not be used for other purposes.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Preparation shall be made for air conditioning of the floor protected spaces using sleeves for the piping and drainage. The opening and sealing of the sleeves shall be done in accordance with the instructions of the
	Home Command. The passage of this or other piping (beyond that connected with air conditioning) by the tenants as part of the modification work, is at the responsibility of the tenants.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.8
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The air conditioning control system shall be located in a place as determined by the company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_64"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.9
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Parking areas &#150; ventilation of the parking areas by means of fans, at least 8 air changes, with control by means of a CO monitoring system.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.10
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Store rooms, technical rooms &#150; ventilation and smoke extraction in accordance with the requirements of the fire service and the air conditioning consultant of the company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.11
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Major channels in a number of points for ventilation of the toilets shall be designed for at least 12 air changes per hour and in accordance with the requirements of the air conditioning consultant.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.12
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Removal of smoke from the floors lobbies in accordance with the instructions of the fire service.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_65"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.1.13
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Subject to receipt of approval from the lessor (including regarding location), the lessee shall be entitled to erect on the roof of the building a fresh air purification system, air conditioning systems, fans, and
	similar equipment for its use. The aforesaid shall be done in accordance with the provisions of section 12 of the leasing agreement, at the full expense and responsibility of the lessee.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	3.2
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Elevators
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_66"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.2.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In stage A there shall be installed in the building 6 passenger elevators (2 in each core) that serve the parking areas from the ground floor to floor 6 (in each core one of them is a stretcher elevator that also
	functions as a service elevator as decided by the management company) in coordination with the management company before transition.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.2.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Size of the elevators &#150; in each core a 17 passenger elevator (load of 1275 kg) and a 21 passenger stretcher elevator (load of 1600 kg).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.2.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The width of regular elevator doors is 110 cm, with central opening. The width of the doors of the stretcher elevator is 130 cm, side opening.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.2.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Tower elevator movement speed: 1.6 m/s.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	3.2.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The elevator cars shall be fitted with an intercom system for communication with the reception desk.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The doors of the elevators and of the shaft shall be made of rigid stainless steel.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<B>
	3.3
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Sanitary plumbing and fire-fighting systems
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>

</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_67"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.3.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A hydrant with the required fittings shall be installed everywhere in the public areas where required by the authorities.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.3.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the entire building there shall be a sprinklers system in accordance with the requirements of the fire service, including pumps and backup of operation during power failures by means of a generator or diesel pumps.
	Storage tanks of the required volumes required for fire-fighting and drinking water. The sprinklers system inside the office spaces shall be made in accordance with the standard for a space without partitions. Modification to the needs of the
	lessees shall be done at their expense and at their responsibility.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="15%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.3.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Air conditioners drainage system near some of the columns of the building in accordance with the design, so that it will be possible to drain the coil fan units in the office areas.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

</TD>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	3.5
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Smoke and fire detection system
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Everywhere that is required by the fire service a fire
	detection system and an emergency PA system has been installed. These systems shall serve the public areas. In areas inside the leased premises it is required to make emergency systems, that may be connected to the central building systems in order
	to receive indications.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:15%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A building control system has been installed that supplies information
	regarding the various public systems to the central desk and to the office of the building manager.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	requirements of the local authority and as set forth in the plans. The work includes,

	inter alia

	, sidewalks, external lighting, gardening, and an irrigation system.
